content: Yes, if you are regularly exposed to sunlight, your body can naturally produce vitamin D. When the skin is exposed to sunlight, the UVB rays interact with a type of cholesterol in the skin to produce vitamin D. The amount of sunlight needed to produce adequate levels of vitamin D varies based on several factors, including your skin tone, age, and the time of year. It is recommended that people aim to spend about 15-30 minutes in the sun each day, without sunscreen, preferably during midday when the sun's UVB rays are strongest. However, it's important to balance sunlight exposure with protecting your skin from sun damage by using sunscreen, wearing hats, and avoiding long periods of unprotected sun exposure.
